story_prompt: Your wife has an estranged sister that you have never met. She was murdered in a cold case soon after you were married. You brush off your wife’s new strange behaviour after the murder as grief. Until you find an old family photo of your wife as a kid, you shiver as you realise… they’re twins.
characters:
---

Character 1: Sarah (Wife) - Age 35
Emotional State: Grief-stricken, paranoid, secretive
Thoughts: "I can't believe it's been 10 years since Emily was killed. I feel like I'm still waiting for her to come back. I've tried to move on, but something about my husband's sudden interest in our family history makes me nervous. I keep finding myself looking over my shoulder, wondering if he's trying to uncover something."

Character 2: Emily (Twin Sister) - Age 35 (Deceased)
Emotional State: Joyful, carefree, content
Thoughts: "I can't believe how much I love this life. I've got everything I could ever want – my beautiful sister, a loving husband, and a happy home. I feel so grateful for all of it, even though I know it can all be taken away in an instant. I just wish my sister would stop being so sad and try to enjoy life with me."

Character 3: Tom (Husband) - Age 35
Emotional State: Curious, intrigued, suspicious
Thoughts: "I can't shake the feeling that there's something more to this story than what my wife is telling me. Why does she seem so nervous and guarded all the time? And why did she suddenly become so interested in our family history? I feel like there's something she's not telling me, and I'm determined to find out what it is."
output: As Sarah walked through the old family photo album, her mind wandered back to the day her sister Emily was killed. She was only 16 at the time, and the memories of that day still haunted her. It had been ten years since then, but the pain still lingered. Her husband Tom, who she had married shortly after Emily's death, had always been supportive and understanding, but as of late, he had become fixated on their family history. At first, Sarah had thought it was cute, him wanting to learn more about their ancestors and where they came from. But now, she couldn't shake the feeling that there was something more to it. As she flipped through the old photos, her eyes landed on one that took her breath away. A picture of her and Emily as kids, standing side by side, both with big smiles on their faces. Sarah felt a shiver run down her spine as she realized something - something she had never considered before. They looked so alike, herself and her sister. So alike, that it was almost eerie. Sarah's mind raced with thoughts of what this meant, of why her husband might be acting so strangely. Had he known all along? Was he hiding something from her? She felt her heart race as she tried to make sense of it all.
